title: (x) Very bold serif faces - Didoni (Pistilli Roman), Caslon {Andrew J Sipe, Yves}
content:
Could somebody please name this type face, I know its in the back of my head somewhere!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120221012518im_/http:/typophile.com/files/example1_4581.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120221012518im_/http:/typophile.com/files/example2_6714.jpg)

Thank you in advance!
author: robbiefa

comments.content: Looks like a Bodoni, perhaps a poster Bodoni.
The bottom italics is something else, like a Garamond.
Nah, the bottom one is a fat Caslon -- check the typical capital 'A'.
Top one is indeed Didoni, the digitized version of the fat face classic [Pistilli Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20120221012518/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20pistilli).
close... I get Caslons and Garamonds mixed up all the time. 50/50 still isn't bad.
